page.title: 05Soil Erosion at Cradley Hall
page.content: At Cradley Hall farm there is soil erosion in all three hopyards. The hops are grown on steep slopes (up to 1 in 6) and the yards are kept weed free. The soils (Bromyard loams) are a mixture of{clay}and{silt}and the use of tractors between the permanent rows has led to a breakdown of the{soil {structure.} Silt is washed away and a capping of clay left. The ruts left by tractor wheels channel run off. This winter Mr. Price hired a contractor to dig a trench across one yard and fill with 3-6" smooth pebbles: this helps{drainage.} Although it is proving successful, it is hard to maintain as the pebbles quickly get covered with clay from tractor wheels. Despite this Mr.Price is planning to do the same in his other yards.
